overview_of_class: Approaches to the rationale, physical and chemical synthesis, assembly and characterization of controlled dimensionality materials including metals, semiconductors, oxides, polymers, and mesoporous scaffolds. Topics will include interfacial phenomena and particle stability, nano-forms of carbon, and applications-driven material design.
name: Design, Synthesis, and Applications of Nanomaterials
title: WCAS CHEM 308-0-01 Design, Synthesis, and Applications of Nanomaterials

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Approaches to the rationale, physical and chemical synthesis, assembly and characterization of controlled dimensionality materials including metals, semiconductors, oxides, polymers, and mesoporous scaffolds. Topics will include interfacial phenomena and particle stability, nano-forms of carbon, and applications-driven material design.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Undergraduate Prerequisite: Chem 342-1 (Thermodynamics) or permission of instructor

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Nanostructures and Nanomaterials by Cao and Wang, 2nd Edition, World Scientific

subject: CHEM
